intro: Oxytropis hedysaroides, commonly known as yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in arid conditions. Oxytropis hedysaroides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility.
